author: fielding
msg: It seemed like a bug to Randy that when compiled with defaults,
Apache fails on systems that don't support the notion of
negative group/user ids.  So he fixed it.
Reviewed by: Chuck Murcko, Roy Fielding

author: fielding
msg: An internal redirect which results in a 304 Not Modified being sent to
the client gets logged as a 200, because the final response code of the
redirect is not propagated to the request structure that is logged.
The logfile then lies about the response status, which is not good for
a webmaster trying to diagnose problems or monitor cache hits.
Fixed by promoting the internal redirect status.
Submitted by: Ben Laurie (with comment mods by Roy Fielding)
Reviewed by: Roy Fielding, Rob Hartill

author: fielding
msg: escape_uri is replaced with a macro calling the newer, spiffier,
improved version of this routine called os_escape_path().
Reviewed by: Rob Hartill, Brian Behlendorf, Randy Terbush

author: pcs
msg: Document use of multiple logs as a what's new item
